New Records: CJ Abrams is the fifth Nationals player with 20 home runs and 20 stolen bases in a season, joining Lane Thomas (2023), Bryce Harper (2016), Ian Desmond (2012, 2013, 2014) and Alfonso Soriano (2006).
Key Match Events: CJ Abrams hit a home run.
Jake Irvin gave up one run and two hits in six innings.
James Wood hit an infield single to drive in a run.
Jose Tena scored a run during the eighth inning.
Keibert Ruiz hit an RBI single to right field during the eighth inning.
Jose Tena stole second base during the eighth inning.
Kyle Finnegan pitched during the ninth inning.
Michael Harris II lined a double to the right-center field wall for the Braves’ first hit with two outs in the top of the sixth.
Jorge Soler followed with a double to put Atlanta on the board.
Dylan Crews added a pair of hits for Washington, including a run-scoring single.
James Wood’s on-base streak reached a career-high 12 games with two singles and an RBI.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker commented on the team's difficulty in scoring runs and the need for more consistent offense.
Max Fried expressed frustration over not being able to control the outcome despite pitching well.
Nationals manager Dave Martinez expressed pride in CJ Abrams' accomplishment and hoped it would help him relax and finish the season strong.
Jake Irvin reflected on his strategy of understanding and pitching around the Braves' hitters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Braves: Reynaldo López returned to the 15-day injured list with right shoulder inflammation. The MRI showed no structural damage.
The team recalled RHP Daysbel Hernández and selected the contract of 2B Cavan Biggio.
INF Luke Williams was optioned to Triple-A Gwinnett.
RHP Jimmy Herget was designated for assignment.
Nationals: RHP Trevor Williams (right flexor muscle strain, 15-day IL) is expected to make at least one more rehab start for Double-A Harrisburg.
Others: The Braves have a day off Thursday and begin a four-game home series with the Dodgers on Friday night.
The Nationals homestand continues when they send LHP Mitchell Parker against the Marlins RHP Darren McCaughan on Thursday night.
